Subjective: Sore throat for 3 days; fever; painful swallowing. No cough, shortness of breath, or runny nose currently. Concerned about abscess; wants antibiotics.
Objective: Temp 38.3Â°C. Throat: slightly red pharyngeal arch, slightly enlarged tonsils with slough bilaterally, no abscess. Ears: normal, slight redness in right ear canal. Lungs: normal vesicular breath sounds, no additional sounds. Neck: small submandibular lymph nodes, non-pathological. Saturation 98%.
Assessment: Viral pharyngitis. No signs of abscess or bacterial infection.
Plan: Continue paracetamol (up to 4 times/day) and ibuprofen (up to 3 times/day, 400mg) for pain
Drink plenty of fluids, try cold drinks or popsicles for pain relief
Safety net: contact if worsening symptoms, shortness of breath, or difficulty swallowing
No antibiotics indicated as likely viral; would only marginally shorten course
